verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.
verses.ct: Once again the people of Israel did what was evil in the LORD's sight, so the LORD handed them over to the Philistines for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And there was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and bare not.
verses.ct: There was a man from Zorah, from the tribe of Dan, named Manoah. His wife had never been able to have children.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD appeared unto the woman, and said unto her, Behold now, thou art barren, and bearest not: but thou shalt conceive, and bear a son.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD appeared to the woman and told her, "Listen, you have been unable to have children, but you will become pregnant and give birth to a son.

verses.kjv: Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing:
verses.ct: So be very careful — don't drink any wine or other alcohol, and don't eat anything that is ritually unclean.

verses.kjv: For, lo, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on his head: for the child shall be a Nazarite unto God from the womb: and he shall begin to deliver Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.ct: Because you are going to become pregnant and give birth to a son. No razor must ever touch his head, because the boy will be set apart as a Nazirite dedicated to God from the moment he is born. He will be the one who begins to rescue Israel from the power of the Philistines."

verses.kjv: Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, A man of God came unto me, and his countenance was like the countenance of an angel of God, very terrible: but I asked him not whence he was, neither told he me his name:
verses.ct: The woman went and told her husband, "A man of God came to me. He looked like an angel of God — absolutely awe-inspiring. I didn't ask where he was from, and he didn't tell me his name.

verses.kjv: But he said unto me, Behold, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, neither eat any unclean thing: for the child shall be a Nazarite to God from the womb to the day of his death.
verses.ct: But he said to me, 'You will become pregnant and give birth to a son. So don't drink any wine or other alcohol, and don't eat anything ritually unclean, because the boy will be a Nazirite dedicated to God from birth until the day he dies.'"

verses.kjv: Then Manoah intreated the LORD, and said, O my Lord, let the man of God which thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the child that shall be born.
verses.ct: Then Manoah prayed to the LORD and said, "Please, Lord, let the man of God you sent come back to us again and teach us how to raise the child who is going to be born."

verses.kjv: And God hearkened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again unto the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah her husband was not with her.
verses.ct: God listened to Manoah's prayer, and the angel of God came again to the woman while she was sitting in the field. But her husband Manoah was not with her.

verses.kjv: And the woman made haste, and ran, and shewed her husband, and said unto him, Behold, the man hath appeared unto me, that came unto me the other day.
verses.ct: The woman quickly ran to tell her husband, saying, "The man who appeared to me the other day is here again!"

verses.kjv: And Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said unto him, Art thou the man that spakest unto the woman? And he said, I am.
verses.ct: Manoah got up and followed his wife. When he reached the man, he asked, "Are you the one who spoke to my wife?" The man replied, "I am."

verses.kjv: And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass. How shall we order the child, and how shall we do unto him?
verses.ct: Manoah said, "When your words come true, what rules should guide the boy's life? What should we do with him?"

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto Manoah, Of all that I said unto the woman let her beware.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD answered Manoah, "Your wife must carefully follow everything I told her.

verses.kjv: She may not eat of any thing that cometh of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing: all that I commanded her let her observe.
verses.ct: She must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, and she must not drink wine or any other alcohol, and she must not eat anything ritually unclean. She must follow every instruction I gave her."

verses.kjv: And Manoah said unto the angel of the LORD, I pray thee, let us detain thee, until we shall have made ready a kid for thee.
verses.ct: Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, "Please stay while we prepare a young goat for you to eat."

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto Manoah, Though thou detain me, I will not eat of thy bread: and if thou wilt offer a burnt offering, thou must offer it unto the LORD. For Manoah knew not that he was an angel of the LORD.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD replied to Manoah, "Even if you keep me here, I won't eat your food. But if you want to prepare a burnt offering, offer it to the LORD." Manoah said this because he still didn't realize that the man was the angel of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Manoah said unto the angel of the LORD, What is thy name, that when thy sayings come to pass we may do thee honour?
verses.ct: Then Manoah asked the angel of the LORD, "What is your name? We want to honor you when your words come true."

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto him, Why askest thou thus after my name, seeing it is secret?
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD responded, "Why do you ask my name? It is beyond understanding."

verses.kjv: So Manoah took a kid with a meat offering, and offered it upon a rock unto the LORD: and the angel did wonderously; and Manoah and his wife looked on.
verses.ct: So Manoah took a young goat along with a grain offering and sacrificed it on a rock to the LORD. Then the angel did something miraculous as Manoah and his wife watched.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, when the flame went up toward heaven from off the altar, that the angel of the LORD ascended in the flame of the altar. And Manoah and his wife looked on it, and fell on their faces to the ground.
verses.ct: As the flame rose up from the altar toward heaven, the angel of the LORD went up in the flame. When Manoah and his wife saw this, they dropped to the ground with their faces down.

verses.kjv: But the angel of the LORD did no more appear to Manoah and to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he was an angel of the LORD.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD never appeared to Manoah and his wife again. At that point, Manoah realized that the man had been the angel of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Manoah said unto his wife, We shall surely die, because we have seen God.
verses.ct: Manoah said to his wife, "We are certainly going to die, because we have seen God!"

verses.kjv: But his wife said unto him, If the LORD were pleased to kill us, he would not have received a burnt offering and a meat offering at our hands, neither would he have shewed us all these things, nor would as at this time have told us such things as these.
verses.ct: But his wife told him, "If the LORD intended to kill us, he wouldn't have accepted our burnt offering and grain offering. He wouldn't have shown us all these things or revealed such promises to us just now."

verses.kjv: And the woman bare a son, and called his name Samson: and the child grew, and the LORD blessed him.
verses.ct: The woman gave birth to a son and named him Samson. The boy grew up, and the LORD blessed him.

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD began to move him at times in the camp of Dan between Zorah and Eshtaol.
verses.ct: The Spirit of the LORD began to stir him at times while he was in the camp of Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
